website_summaries.verdict: Extremely tough and durable boot for riding and hiking.
pros: Footbed contains shock-absorbing gel for all-day comfort, making it popular with sufferers of plantar fasciitis as well as other foot and knee ailments
Oiled leather is waterproof, while the antibacterial lining wicks moisture
cons: The zip version may feel tight across the front of the foot, so those with high arches should stick with the laced option

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are GREAT! I got the Goretex (all-weather) hiker/barn boots. I had an old pair so I KNEW that the sizing is ample ...I wear an 8/8.5 in shoes and I got the 8 in these. The width is commodious (particularly in the toe area which is what is so important to me) ...I normally wear a b-width and these were wonderful. The day they arrived I put them on that morning and wore them all day as it was rainy and cold and I had to be out a good bit and on my feet. They offer great support and your feet do not get wet either from weather or sweat! Oh and I am in my 70s!
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Ariat is NOT for me!
customer_reviews.text: This boot was a little bit narrow but it stretched out and was not unbearablely tight. BUT this was not my first ariat boot I've had but it will be my last! It seems that ariat loses it's support very quickly. This pair of boots didn't last 4 months which was even less time than the other pair I had. Putting insoles in didn't help a bit. For me, they are not worth the money AT ALL!
customer_reviews.author: Yellarose

customer_reviews.title: Best boots you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: First, I went with Columbia for hiking boots because of price and style but I returned them due to fit. So I was hesitant to buy another pair but I saw ariat made hiking boots! I own a pair of ariat mud stompers and they are absolutely my favorite footwear. At first, I was worried that they were tight. The second wearing, they seemed to loosen up. So I will continue to break them in before my hike. They’re very light. They are definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: No need to break in! Perfect fit and comfort, sturdy, cute
customer_reviews.text: Best. Hikers. Ever! Took a chance ordering these right b4 a trip 2 Alaska. Plantar fasciitis acting up :( and no time to break in the hikers. These shoes were perfect from the moment I put them on and never let me down. Others said they run small - not 4 me. My feet are verified (measured) 8.5 medium width and the shoes fit perfectly. (Maybe others wearing thicker socks?) My friends thought they were cute. Lived in them for a week and no complaints. Kept trying to rotate to other shoes, but changing right back to these. I will look for more shoes in this brand!
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: No consistency. Less than one star.
customer_reviews.text: So very disappointed. I bought this same boot over a year ago because it is an awesome boot. Wore for barn chores, rode horses, grocery shopping... every day wear. Started to look ragged so bought this second pair, mind you, I matched size and Ariat item number to ensure I was getting the SAME boot. They couldn’t have been more different for fit... not even close to my original pair. Very uncomfortable. Sent back. This is becoming a theme with Ariat footwear. They seem to lack QC for fit. Not sure I’ll ever try them again.
customer_reviews.author: SNeary

customer_reviews.title: Busted seams and ripped leather in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: First, I have always had great luck with Ariat. They are my go-to for tall boots, paddock boots, and general barn boots. Most pairs have lasted me several years of regular use in all weather and footing types. But not this pair. I tried this waterproof version of the Ariat Terrain after two pairs of the other version lasting me over two decades. This pair- less than 1 year. Bought these boots Aug 2017 and by July 2018 they have huge holes in them. They have not had any crazy use, just barn chores. The fit at first is comfortable, but it is much stiffer than the non-waterproof style. I’m bummed these didn’t last at all. What happened, Ariat?
customer_reviews.author: K T

customer_reviews.title: Not the same.....
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 pairs of these boots already and they are roomy in the toe area. I ordered a 3rd pair and they were narrower. When I checked them over carefully to see what was different, I noticed that the first 2 pair that I have were made in China and this new pair was made in Vietnam. I had to return them because they hurt my little toe, they were so narrow. I ordered the same boot from Zappos and it was labeled made in China, like my original 2 pair and they fit properly with plenty of toe room.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Macy

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT water proof or warm! They are nice hiking boots comfort wise, but I bought them for waterproof and they are not. Super disappointed. They would be decent riding boots or work boots but mediocre hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Lbz123

customer_reviews.title: Perfect paddock boot
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wears these year round for horse chores. She wore a hole in her last pair that lasted many years. We live in NE WI and the weather can be different in an hours time! They are the perfect chore boot for spring, summer, and fall and most winter days, too!
customer_reviews.author: flowerlvr

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This boot is comfortable from day one. No break in time required. The verdict on how long it will last is still out. Only time can tell that - Well, less than 4 month into wearing this boot, the seams are opening up already. For that price I expect a better quality!
customer_reviews.author: DMR

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionaln Boots
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking boots I've ever worn -- for comfort, fit, and durability. Excellent grip ability on rocky terrain while maintaining flexibility of the sole. I'm in my mid-fifties, and rely heavily on my boots to help me traverse our mountain property safely. My wide foot does not feel great fatigue even after wearing these from dawn to dusk. The boots are not heavy on the foot, nor "clunky" as some hiking boots can bet. I'm impressed by the quality of materials as well. They've worn a lot better than a pair of Timberlands I wore prior to investing in these. I'll be turning to Ariat again when it's time to invest again. Thanks, Ariat, for this great pair of hikers.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these for a group trek to Everest Base Camp this Spring. Two of us had enough sense to wear them a couple times before we went, and were fine. The third didn't, and she got blisters on the backs of her heels. I think they are great boots and very comfortable and require the bare minimum of break in. They are a little heavier than tennis shoes, but provide more ankle support. As stated, I bought three of them. It was a good purchase. I did put Dr. Scholl's sports gel insert in these (and all my shoes) and wore wool socks.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothea L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots but poor traction for winter walking
customer_reviews.text: I really like, and kept these boots because they fit well and are very comfortable and warm for winter walking in New England. I took the insole out and replaced it with an orthotic with more arch support. However, I walk on wooded trails of packed snow and ice and these boots are very slippery- I solved this problem by wearing Yak Traks on these boots (if you don't already know, Yak Traks are amazing!) so now I can enjoy the comfort of the boot and also have excellent traction with no worries of slipping. Hope this helps some winter walkers.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: no surrport in footbed.. hurt the feet
customer_reviews.text: sent another pair excellent fit and perfect for my feet very pleased with amazon as always.. perfect thanks so much guys the new replacement excellent fit and perfect for my walking wow what a difference not sure on why the first ones hurt the feet and my right big toe like it had pressure on the end and nail..
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: comfort + function = value
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a day trip last October when I went both hiking and horseback riding (because they have a defined heel to prevent my foot slipping through the stirrup), and these boots performed wonderfully. They were comfortable out of the box, both in terms of fit and temperature. I wore them for a full day without breaking them in and had no problems. Since then they have held up really well. They give great value in terms of quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M.L.

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable generally, but you do need to break it 4/5
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable and very supportive, but I have gotten blisters from extensive hikes and they do need to be broken in. I got these anticipating hiking in the mountains of the PNW with my girlfriends, which I did, but I was hoping they wouldn't destroy my ankles with blisters, but that still happened. They are indeed waterproof and breathe really well regardless. I like them, just wish they had held up to the whole "no breaking in needed" that I bought them for.
customer_reviews.author: Katheryn Camm

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoes, price was deceptive
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes...my last pair lasted over 15 years! They're perfect for work, they're comfortable, they're waterproof & my feet stay pretty warm even tho I'm working on concrete all day. My #1 complaint is that I was overcharged by the seller. The advertised price at purchase was $86 & when I got my invoice I noticed I'd been charged $114. Thankfully a couple of wonderful Amazon customer service agents were very helpful & I received a refund from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Nuzee61

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for any season
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is comfortable and fits as expected. However, it doesn't breathe at all. Perhaps it will work well as a winter shoe. I needed a year round shoe and my feet sweat like crazy during the 2 seasons I've worn them. My fault for thinking that leather would work year round. Now that winter is here, they don't work well in snow either. When the leather gets wet my feet get cold and stay that way.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ferber

customer_reviews.title: Returned these
customer_reviews.text: The boots didn't fit quite right, maybe a little big. I have an older pair, not waterproof, that are getting really worn. I think I purchased them about 16 years ago and have worn them for hiking and horse back riding over the years. The original ones were 6 1/2 and the new ones were 7. These felt more like hiking boots and I have a nice pair of those. They appeared to be good quality, just not what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: ccp

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: I really like the boots although, I haven't ridden in them yet. They're well made, light weight & comfortable. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because the soles are a little slick on certain terrain, like going down a steep slope or on wet leaves. I'm not on that type of terrain very often so, it's not too much of a concern. I totally recommend them, the price is good & they're quite versatile!
customer_reviews.author: reaper wife

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, definitely water-proof, good arch support
customer_reviews.text: I love these Ariat hiking boots! This is the 2nd pair I've owned, this time ordering the waterproof ones. They definitely did not let any water in, as I walked in the edge of a river and stood there taking pictures of wild horses for 10 minutes! (As long as the water doesn't go above the top of the boot of course!). I need good arch support and these hit me just right. My prior pair lasted me probably 8 years, hiking in Arizona.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear around a dog kennel. When I bought these I was going for carpet to concrete to gravel. On my feet 8+ hours a day. They are very comfortable and durable. As long as I didn't stand in one place for to long, on concrete. I used alot of bleach when cleaning the kennels and pens and they are still going strong. The only thing is that the rubber tip on the end of the shoes started to come off after a month or so. They are still on. The laces on the other hand finally gave out a month ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Kirby

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old boots are still in good condition except for that fact
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered these hiking boots 3 times over the years. They wear very well except over time the waterproofness lessens, as would be expected. My 3 year old boots are still in good condition except for that fact. They make great hiking boots, waterproof, light and break in easily after a few wears. I don't ride horses but was turned on to these boots while watching my daughter ride. So glad I found them. I would suggest gators when being used in snow to prevent snow from coming into boot top and perhaps a more frequent waterproofing would have been in order by me.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Stiff and poor traction
customer_reviews.text: Wore these Ariat's hiking in the White Mountains this week and was so disappointed. These boots are so stiff and traction is so poor that I slid all over the place on trails that any of my past boots would have easily handled. Also, the ankle is very wide. I have an average ankle size but these are extremely wide. The rest of our trip I resorted to my TEVA hiking sandals with a good pair of socks. My Teva's got wet, but I always had sure footing and no issues. Will keep looking for a better boot.
customer_reviews.author: Jbeau

customer_reviews.title: A+ fit and feel
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my girlfriend for a hiking trip we were taking. She wore these the entire trip and really loved them. So much so that she wants to wear them now, regularly even if the situation doesn’t exactly call for them. She’s much happier with them than either of us expected, so I would very highly recommend them to anyone looking.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pair for about 2 years now. I've brought this pair with me to a number of national parks, Macchu Pichu, and countless hikes. I am in LOVE with this boots. I wear these with a good pair of wool socks and my feet are so comfortable during long hikes (even when it was raining, still dry!). Very cute, I've been asked many times where I've purchased them. I also think it's worth mentioning that I'm typically a 6.5 but I bought it in 6 and am glad I did. Fit nice and snug and surprisingly didn't have a problem breaking them in. Absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Best boot for Plantar fasciitis!!
customer_reviews.text: These boots quickly became my favorite shoes and replaced my tennis shoes! I have no trouble with my feet, don't even need my insterts (I have plantar fasciitis and heel spurs). They are very comfortable, even after 15-20K steps a day! Rain or shine, these are the best shoes I've purchased in a very long time! Well worth the money and the fit is perfect! So impressed!! (I've been wearing them daily for about 5 months).
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M

customer_reviews.title: If You Run Between Sizes, Buy In The Smaller Size
customer_reviews.text: I range between an 8.5 and 9 in shoes. After reading the reviews, I decided to go with the 8.5 and I’m so glad I did. The boots fit perfectly with just the right amount of room in the toe box. They were so comfortable from the second I put them on throughout the two hours I wore them. The color is amazing. Super neutral rich brown, so dirt and wear over time will be less obvious. The grip on the sole does not look like it would be great, but the grip is actually awesome. Can’t wait to wear these on all of our future hikes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Trekked Through Ireland With These
customer_reviews.text: I will forever only use these shoes for hiking or trekking through any terrain. I spent two months walking through Europe and started in Ireland where there were a lot of wetlands. Not once did my feet ever get cold or wet. Even after my trip, they are still like new (treat them well, they will continue to treat you well.) I have been on many hikes since with rocky and dry climate. These shoes are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Thisiskrista

customer_reviews.title: Slip, sliding, and stirrupless
customer_reviews.text: I looove these boots... except... The boot itself is great. I’ve never had riding boots that don’t feel tight through the whole toe box so it’s nice that these are roomy without feeling clumsy or insecure. The downside to these boots is actually the sole. There is ZERO grip. In the stirrups, they slide and it’s hard to keep them in the right spot. On the ground, I have slipped and fallen on mildly damp grass and went for a wild slide ride in mud. I can’t imagine trying to hike in these in anything but dry weather on secure ground.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot, Excellent Seller
customer_reviews.text: I bought these from Wild West Boot Store in a size 7.5, my usual size. They were just a little large, though. I returned and requested a 1/2 size smaller. Very easy exchange. The store folks were very nice! Received my size 7 quickly and I am so happy with this boot. It is perfect. Thank you to all who have reviewed it previously. I made a great decision! I have somewhat narrow feet so sizing is a crapshoot for me, especially in boots which is why I decided to purchase from a regular store. These seem to be a high quality, solid and comfortable boot. Highly recommend both seller and boot.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Working vacation for your feet!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I usually have to put expensive orthotics in all my shoes, but these are great out of the box. No break in, wore them to the barn and then to an all-day event walking a few miles of lumpy terrain in mud, muck, grass and water and my feet were happy all day! Fit it TTS for Ariat boots with roomy toe box. Love!
customer_reviews.author: EBV

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for around the ranch. If you're cleaning 21 stalls & turning horse out your feet will be comfortable, although my recc. Would be muck arctic weekend boots mid calf. However these ariat are GREAT if you have a past foot injury they are very supportive. If you order your Real Size they fit roomy enough for thick socks bit you can also wear regular socks. For example, I wear a 7 1/2 in good shoes, 8 in, say, merrell. I got 7 1/2 and it's perfect. You might find these a bit warm in summer if doing serious horse/ farm work, but they are really good shoes.
customer_reviews.author: realtime

customer_reviews.title: Loved the looks, loved the quality...but...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVED them...great quality, rugged good looks. But there is a BUT. I have a very low instep and narrow foot, and these are normal sized, maybe even generous (I am a 9, I think I could have ordered an 8 1/2). I was not able to tighten the laces enough to snug up around me, even with thick socks. The extra wiggle room actually raised a blister. So most reluctantly and with much regret, I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Christine27106

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected and truly waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a little larger based on reviews (wear 8, ordered 8-1/5) and they fit perfectly with room for thick socks. Ordered wide and they are just right. Can wear them all day and they don't bother my bunion at all. Have a defined heel for traction on the trails and two months after buying and using them several times a week, they still look like new. Living in the Pacific northwest, was skeptical about them being waterproof, but they keep my feet dry and toasty whether I'm in town or walking dogs on wet, muddy trails. Worth their weight in gold! Would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: dody in washington

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is defective.
customer_reviews.text: I've had so many pairs of these shoes. I'm so disappointed in Ariat this time. Please see photos. I ordered these on August 30,20. I've worn them maybe 15 times. Am so sick of trying to find a place on Amazon to tell them about this shoe. It's an endless circle. It's been years since I could afford new Ariats, then this!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: I like the color and quality of these boots. Need to wear 2 pairs of heavy socks and add pad inserts with arch support for best comfort. Added lace locks. No breaking in boots. I really like the toe bumper for protection. Sizing is my normal, but these run a little big but I like that for incline and decline hiking. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Stockman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful hiking boots. I took these brand new with me on a trip to the Big Island and unboxed them there. I was nervous they'd hurt since they were not broken in but they did great! I didn't experience any pain or rubbing. They're very comfortable, durable, and have great grips. I did a lot of climbing on lava rock and various jagged edges and they performed well. Aesthetically they're fairly cute for hiking boots. I like that they're black and brown, they can match anything.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Unisex boot
customer_reviews.text: I'm a small guy with small feet and it's difficult to find decent work boots in my size. Women's sizes are simply listed as two sizes larger than mens, but often women's boots have feminine colors on them. However, there was no difference between the mens and women's versions of these boots. Ariat didn't offer my size in mens so I bought the women's and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: C width is NO WIDER than B width
customer_reviews.text: Had been wearing 7-B width in exact same boot. A little tight across the instep and footbed so when time for new I ordered 7-C (unable to find the wide width in stores). Found the C width to be a smaller width than my old B width when compared sole-to-sole. I get it that the B may have flattened out over the 4 or so years I’ve worn them but not so much to be larger then an advertised C width.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE
customer_reviews.text: If you love Ariat already....these will not disappoint. I wanted something besides my regular everyday boots to wear in the winter months - I'm very happy with these. They keep my feet dry while I'm out doing barn chores. They're also nice enough that I wear them every day. No rubbing, no sores - comfortable from day 1.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy M.

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof protection and great fit.
customer_reviews.text: Love these!! Now on third pair. Waterproof?? Absolutely!!! I can run hose directly over them, tromp through mud and muck. I have insulated pair for more warmth in the winter. Can't beat Ariat!! Available in wide width..a plus plus for me!
customer_reviews.author: John O’Neill

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday work boots.
customer_reviews.text: I am very particular when it comes to my feet. I have had surgery on both of them from working on concrete floors for the past 30 years. I bought these based off the reviews that they will last and stay comfortable for a long time. I wear them almost every day to work in a manufacturing industry and they help keep my feet from hurting by the end of the day. They fit true to size and I can wear a thicker sock if I chose to. Great boots. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Kay NH

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a boat that would work well for situations where my sneakers weren’t appropriate. These definitely fit his bill. They fit like a sneaker but work like a boot, if that makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Fortenbery

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with these Boots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots for hiking and they fit as expected. I purchased a sz 7 which is what I normally wear. I read the sizing instructions on the Ariat website. The toe is roomy, which allows me to wear thicker socks and gives my foot the space it needs without causing blisters. I wore them the 1st time hiking in a tall grass heavy dew and my feet stayed dry. I did clean them up after, condition and spray with a waterproof silicone just for added insurance.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: good fit, no tread
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find hiking boots that fit my small but wide feet well. These did fit and were comfortable, but there's hardly any chunky tread on the bottom that I need for hiking. They're really more of a flat-ground walking shoe. So I ended up returning them. If you're not planning to hike on actual soil where you need the traction, they'd probably be nice shoes.
customer_reviews.author: emmapeel

customer_reviews.title: This is the 4th pair of these boots that I've bought in the past 10 years.
customer_reviews.text: I raise goats on a farm. I wear these boots nearly every day of the year. I have to replace them about every 18 months. They are the most comfortable boots I've found for my hard-to-fit wide feet. They are really waterproof. We have had an extremely wet summer, and the ground is almost squishy wet. My feet stay dry when I wear my Ariats. The only drawback is that they are not good in slippery conditions, I put crampons on them when we have ice or light snow on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Donovan

customer_reviews.title: If you want hiking boots that last....
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many pairs of Ariat boots over the years. I have horses and use them doing barn chores and riding, etc. This pair I bought recently is strictly for hiking. They are sturdy but also have enough "give" around the ankles so as not to feel too stiff. I know these will last for many years if cared for properly. Good job, Ariat!
customer_reviews.author: D. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good shoes
customer_reviews.text: They fit very well, which is great because most shoes I buy online do not, and they were able to wear immediately all day. There are not too many hiking shoes you can feel like you've broken in this quickly, and for this price, they are well worth the buy. I wear them every day now. I hope they hold up as well as hiking boots that are well over $100, because as of right now, it feels like I got that kind of value. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: JohnB

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, light, leaks after few wears.
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide foot and these are comfortable after a few wears. Not quite waterproof like they say. The sole loosened from the leather after just a few wear to the shoes leak, which was dissapointing. But they fit and their light. Hard to keep spurs in the right spot though, I had to tie them under the heel. Not made for riding obviously, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: I really like these boots. I have multiple old injuries and wide feet so I have a hard time finding comfortable boots. These are so comfortable and sturdy. No break in time, I just wore them out the first day with no pain issues. I was worried that the instep would be too high since others mentioned it had that type of support, but it was fine. I usually wear an 8 wide and the 8 wide I ordered was perfect. They are not super non slip on ice, but pretty good. There is no boot that is anti slip where I live...
customer_reviews.author: SueS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Boots
customer_reviews.text: I'm always a little skeptical when I order something I've never seen or tried on before to know how they will fit or look. I was very pleased with my purchase this time. These boots are well made and comfortable. I wore them around my house after receiving them but unfortunately I only had thin socks to wear with them. They were still comfortable although a little loose without the proper socks. I'm looking forward to wearing them on our trip to Big Bend!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Najvar

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and actually waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! As a zookeeper in FL, I need something comfortable and waterproof to stand up to the frequent thunderstorms. These do! My only problem is they seem big in the toe area, the shoe size fits, but they almost fit like a wide width, and I don’t have narrow feet at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable from the first time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear at the barn for casual riding. I liked them so much they never made it to the barn. I instead wear them to work in my casual work environment. I would buy them again. They support my ankles which makes my knees feel better after a day standing on them.
customer_reviews.author: annie

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I get a pair of these boots for my dads birthday every year. He alternates wearing them and absolutely loves them. He is a cattle rancher so they get a lot of use in the elements and he is always sad when he has to break out a new pair but is grateful he has a new pair to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Dendria D. McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, just not everyday uses.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last as long as I hoped. They are still comfortable to a point, but the back wall against the heel is falling apart and is giving me bad cuts and sores on the back of my heel. Yes the shoes fit great and love them, just wish they didnt break down after three months. Also they are no longer waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic comfortable boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I’ve owned them for going on 10 years. I am a huge Ariat fan and these boots confirm why. They last for a long time and I get a lot of miles out of them. The fit is perfect and they are super comfort for my 4-6 hour trail rides.
customer_reviews.author: Chick Fluff

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot for the Outdoors
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for everyday wear, hiking and hunting. I was so pleased I purchased another pair. My husband liked the style so much that he bought himself a pair. He wears them to work daily and loves the light weight of these boots. A plus is they are water resistant. Works well when used for outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: Debee W

customer_reviews.title: A good boot for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to Alaska in a few months and I needed a solid pair of hiking boots at a decent price. Over all the fit is very good. While breaking them in though I did get a blister right at the ankle because of the way the boot is cut and where the rim hits. If they were 1/2 an inch higher, they would been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: texaschristina

customer_reviews.title: comfortable out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I already owned a pair of Ariat Terrain in a different style (Serape) and loved them so much I wanted to have those for wear outside of the barn. I purchased these because they were waterproof as well. I love them! Out of the box they are comfortable. They kept my feet dry when walking through puddles.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my wife as I have a similar men's pair that I bought at a local store. These boots are light weight and durable. They provide excellent support for feet and ankles. I like that they don't have a lug sole, so they don't collect dirt and track into your house. Easy to clean. I treated mine with a light coat of leather honey prior to the first use. Rubber armoring at the toe and heel will extend the life of the boots. They look small on your feet. I plan to get another pair if and when mine wear out.
customer_reviews.author: BarryJ

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for whatever you like.
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. They are extremely comfortable, that's why I buy anything Ariat just for that reason. They have a lot of bounce to them, my feet never feel tired after hiking, working, or riding! I would recommend tall socks with these, they dig in a bit to the ankle but nothing so bad that it makes me want to take them off. I love the color and the quality as well. Great boots I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Putman

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: I haven't worn these out yet so I'll update when I do. I wear a 9 in heels/flats and a 10 in boots/sneakers. I ordered a 10 and it fits great Update: I wore them hiking in the grand canyon and they worked fine. I wish they had better ankle support but I will continue to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good Boot!
customer_reviews.text: This boot is comfortable right out of the box. Very happy with the look and fit. I bought them for riding and they should be great for that, sturdy without being stiff. Lots of room in the toes Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: jaye

customer_reviews.title: Probably with super heavy winter socks they'll be better this winter and ...
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 7. I measured my foot and read reviews so ordered a 6 1/2 normal width. I still have a bit too much room at the toe and even laced up tightly they just aren't snug enough to give the support I need. Probably with super heavy winter socks they'll be better this winter and I can always use them for just riding. Thinking of ordering a size 6 since there are free returns. Really LIKE the boot tho, just wish it fit me securely.
customer_reviews.author: Donnajdee

customer_reviews.title: NICE STURDY AND SUPPORTIVE HIKING BOOT
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated buying these because the width was described as a C and I have a wide foot. However, I found they fit very well and although I have not yet hiked in them, I anticipate no problems. They feel sturdy and well-made and look pretty good too! There is not much extra room for a thick sock but I won't be wearing them in very cold weather so I think they will work great.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Birmingham

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality! I wear them as work boots M-F and have definitely broke them in. I got a 7 1/2 just in case it would be too small but they’re actually a bit too big on me so I trip over them a lot. That being said, they should probably be scuffed a lot, but are not. They still look nice! I’m hoping to go hiking a lot now that it’s summer, and I will definitely reach for these.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Joy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, stylish
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these boots only because they didn't have the traction required for a long and strenuous (all rocky terrain) hike. Otherwise, I would have kept them with pleasure. Very comfortable, stylish, light weight, and perfect height especially if you have weak ankles.
customer_reviews.author: New York Heart

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots
customer_reviews.text: They do appear water resistant. They are comfortable for riding and hiking. I ride and hike a lot so was looking for a hiking/riding boot. I've hiked in some rocky terrain and they were comfortable so far. Haven't put a lot of miles on them yet but I have no reason to believe they won't get even more comfortable with use.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Truly waterproof. Super comfortable and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these boots! I never thought I would find a perfect fit for a truly waterproof boot for hiking in Florida. Sometimes I trudge through flooded wetlands and I come out looking like these boots are new after a quick wipe or brush. I can't say enough good things about these boots. I wish there were more colors available in my size, 7C
customer_reviews.author: Sage-pants

customer_reviews.title: RETURN THIS ONE
customer_reviews.text: Tried again, but those ARIAT boots are too stiff. Won't order theirs again.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Run a size smaller
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 9 wide, but they seemed big. So before returning I ordered the next size down. Perfect. Funny because I ordered a pair of Ariat work boots at the same time. Just the opposite, the 8.5 wide was too small and I've ordered a 9 wide hoping they will fit.
customer_reviews.author: Les Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great work and/or riding boot
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair when my first pair was accidentally thrown into the donation pile of clothes (grrr). The boots are sturdy, comfortable and waterproof (let's just say my feet always stayed dry in these boots). My first pair got a lot of wear horseback riding and working in the yard, yet they managed to always look almost new once the mud dried and dusted off. When I wear my brown suede half-chaps with these boots, I get a lot of nice complements on my "knee high" boots. I love these boots and feel they are worth every penny if you need a good work boot and/or riding boot.
customer_reviews.author: MsJake

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pair of hiking boots for hiking and horseback riding. Ordered 8.5 ( my true size) in wide and they fit perfectly . I wear medium thick wool socks with them and my feet stay toasty warm all day. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Best work boots. Repeat customer.
customer_reviews.text: This was the first work boot I purchased 5 years ago when I began teaching riding lessons. I continue to re-purchase the same boot almost annually as I do a lot of walking). They have great support. They do fit a little more narrow than other boots which is good for my narrow foot.
customer_reviews.author: Joyfull

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy them again and again.
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these and absolutely wore them out. Usually, I'm happy to try a new or different boot when it's time to replace the old ones. This time there was no question - - I immediately ordered the same boots again. Working on a ranch around horses these are truly an all purpose boot. They're comfortable (thanks to Ariats' great soles), they keep your feet warm and happy, and they last a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: Stuckenfoo

customer_reviews.title: Love These Hiking Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Ariat Hiking boots that I purchased over 10 years ago for horse back riding. They have held up against mud, water, rocks, stomping of hooves and general wear and tear. I wear them a lot for the ankle support they deliver as well. These new boots appear to be made of the same quality materials and craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Elizleo

customer_reviews.title: H20 version does not fit the same as non-H20
customer_reviews.text: The H20 version of the women's Ariat Terrain does not fit as well as the non-H20 version. They are uncomfortable. I have tried 2 different pairs bought at different times. Strange....
customer_reviews.author: Muleshu

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: While it took the left shoe a while to break in, these boots fit the bill perfectly. I do a lot of hiking and these things are AMAZING!!! You have to learn to lace them up to your foot and you will fall in love with them.
customer_reviews.author: JdLewis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boot!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are wonderfully comfortable, right out of the box!! No break in time, NONE! They fit great- arch support, lightweight, cut out at the back of the ankle, flexible and soft. Plenty of toe room, arch support without any tightness on the top of your foot, heel is cradled. Tongue is gusseted to just under the top two eyelets. I can work in them all day without any issue! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Paige D.

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love these Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these boots! They are well made and super comfy! I've walked up and down steep embankments and rugged rocks and these boots were comfortable and sturdy the entire hike. They also surprisingly gripped super well on uneven ground. Best boots ever!
customer_reviews.author: Angel.P

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these boots. They are very comfortable and great hiking boots. Of course they are Ariat boots and I have never had a bad pair of Ariat boots.
customer_reviews.author: Dale & Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof boots and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: My wife pretty much lives in her Ariat boots. She wears her boots almost every day at the barn. From riding the tractor to groom the arena, to riding horses and mucking stalls. We live in the Northwest so we get quite a bit of rain. The boots are absolutely waterproof. I also own a pair of Ariat boots aslo.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Araits are the beat!
customer_reviews.text: I love these Ariat boots. They are great for the barn and for riding my horse. This was my third pair but I must have ordered the wrong suze. They were too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Best Darn boots!
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple pair of Ariat cowboy boots. They are the best fitting shoes I have so I bought these hiking/work boots. I can be on my feet all day long with no knee or back pain! These are high quality boots and I love them and so do my feet! I will always buy Ariat.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed. My wife and I have worn these shoes ...
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. My wife and I have worn these shoes almost exclusively for the past several years. I reordered the same size and model for my wife but the new pair does not fit the same. They are slightly too large causing quite a bit of foot pain. She has chronic foot pain and, previously, these shoes were the only ones she could wear. What do we do? Order another pair in the hopes that it was a sizing anomaly?
customer_reviews.author: Jim Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Great boot at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: So glad based on reviews I took a leap of faith and opted for these over boots that were much more expensive. I wear a 9.5 and often certain shoes can make my feet look huge. Not these. Actually makes my foot look smaller. Plenty of arch support. Toe box perfect and comfortable (even with a bunion on my right foot). Waterproof and relatively lightweight. Felt great right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L. Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but coming apart after 60 days!
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and very comfortable but sadly are coming apart at the seams 60 days into wearing them :-( I wear them for daily use in hot weather. Not even hiking or heavy work. Just need sturdy shoes for environment I’m in. Hope they hang in there for another month because I don’t have another pair with me.
customer_reviews.author: Aida

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever !
customer_reviews.text: I volunteer at a rescue ranch and am on my feet all day and often trudging through muck. These are the most comfortable boots and being waterproof is a great plus. Most of the staff and the volunteers can be found sporting them because word is that they are the best. In addition to their comfort, I can also hop on a horse if needed and not have to change into riding boots. I love them and can't imagine life without them. I also told a friend that does landscape work and she is delighted with them also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wearing comfortably
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these hiking for a few months now. They started a wee stiff, but after two wears, fit like a glove. They have remained waterproof through much mud and puddles. THey rise off well and keep looking great. THey have the supportive comfortable foot bed I have come to love from Ariat boots.
customer_reviews.author: Alison loves bunnies

customer_reviews.title: My favorite boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I do barn & yard chores in them and horse back ride in them. I usually get about 2 years out of them and have been buying them for years. Waterproof too!
customer_reviews.author: Carl K Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: My new favor shoe. If they were more feminine and or dressy I would wear to work! I wear these every chance I get. I didn’t have to break them in comfy from the get go.
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these shoes. Well made, attractive boot. They run a little small, I usually wear a 9 but 8 1/2 works great for me, including boot socks. I had another pair I used working on a farm, held up wonderfully, kept my feet happy, reduced leg fatique, and I still use for "bumming " around. With the heel design, you can go from hiking to horseback riding, a wonderful investment!
customer_reviews.author: Dapplegray

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and foot support.
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this boot for years. They fit me right away and are comfortable, no breaking in period. This is the only boot I've found that I don't need to use inserts for foot support. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Gottsacker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved these shoes. I wore them for long-distance horse riding in Iceland, spending as many as 8 hours a day in the saddle in all kinds of terrains and both at speed and while moseying around. Combined with a good pair of chaps, they were perfect for my needs. I also used them for hikes in and around Iceland and on trails near my home as well as daily walking in the city. They have enough support for all circumstances. Very snug fit possible with the lacing which I enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: B. McRae

customer_reviews.title: Order 1/2 size smaller
customer_reviews.text: I should have ordered 1/2 size smaller. This is a quality boot but heavier than I wanted so I ordered the non waterproof Ariat terrain boot. I'm so glad I did. There was no breaking in period. They were comfortable the minute I put them on. I'm also able to use my own orthotics.
customer_reviews.author: D SHAW

customer_reviews.title: miss marked boot size
customer_reviews.text: purchased early to replace my previous pair that had not totally worn out yet PROBLEM is Box states 10 MED hanging tag says 10 MED however the inside of boot says 8.5 Very disappointed and i should have checked them on arrival now I am out over $100.00 Missed the return timeline
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Nice and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really like these boots. They're extremely comfortable without having to "break them in". I've only worn them a few times so far so I can't say how well they hold up yet, but so far I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Noyes

customer_reviews.title: They're My Favorites!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these before and love them, it's the only thing I'll wear around the horse barn. Sturdy, but lightweight make them great for walking all over the place. They actually sent me the wrong width, a C instead of a D, but the wider size seem fine so I kept them. This is my 3rd pair and I still use the old beat up ones occasionally. (I wear them daily for at least 2 hours a day longer on weekends)
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Favorite outdoor boots
customer_reviews.text: I wear these boots for everything outdoors and in all weather. Including horse back riding, cleaning the barn hay hauling and stacking, hiking and gardening. This is my third pair. Each pair has lasted about 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: CBarker

product_meta.title: Ariat Women’s Terrain H2O Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: These will help eat up the miles and get to the finish. Waterproof Pro keeps feet dry, ATS footbeds reduce fatigue, and Duratread outsoles grip and flex; these are proven, tested endurance rider's boots for the long haul.
feature_bullets: Waterproof, oiled full-grain leather upper^Waterproof membrane construction^Padded collar^Moisture wicking lining^Self cleaning Dura tread outsole
